question: Yashasvi Jaiswal, who became the youngest cricketer to score 200 in ODI, is from which city?
explanation: On 16th of October, the 17-year-old  Mumbai teenager Yashasvi Jaiswal created history as he became the youngest cricketer in the world to score a double century  in 50-overs cricket including List A and ODIs. He  scored 203 in 154 balls against Jharkhand in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy at Alur, Karnataka. His, scintillating innings helped Mumbai set a mammoth target of 359 for Jharkhand in the Elite Group A match.
